attributes.action: A no confidence vote at the top of the ballot for all future general elections.
attributes.additional_details: It would be a better representative democracy if people could choose a no confidence vote until a candidate was acceptable, this is evidenced by UK Election Statistics: 1918-2019: A Century of Elections (2020), as of 2019, 32.7% of the UK did not vote in the general election, and over 100,000 ballots were spoilt. A no confidence vote would also be a better alternative to those that currently vote only because they do not wish for a running party leader to be given the premiership.
attributes.background: To give the people of the UK the option that no candidate on the electoral ballot is representing their convictions. A no confidence vote should extend to by-elections, local elections, and referendums.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325459
